title: Confessions of a Broken Blade: Yasuo x Riven

replies.body:
Not sure what the protocol is for linking to folks who have read stuff before even I have ;)  but Necrit has a video up with a reading of it, if you'd rather consume words through your ears instead.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dN0N_BApPzM
Why do Riven and Yasuo get lore content that's loyal to their stories but other characters have their lore wholesale deleted?
Other than altered lore due to updates, I'm not really sure what you are talking about. Could you list a few examples?
Probably the biggest gripe with the community was when they changed Varus from a family man to two lovers.

I kinda agree with you on this one. As someone who really enjoyed his kinda reverse Yasuo lore (Rather than running to save the village, follow duty and protect the elder) it was a massively dramatic change that overall changed his character. However, I do understand why Riot decided on this, as his previous lore fit very mediocre with being a Darkin, where his new lore fits very strongly. Yes, the old lore is gone and Varus is essentially changed forever do to it, but League is an ever evolving game, and Riot is bound to mess up when they take risks.

Other than the Varus change, do you have any other (preferably that don't accompany a VGU) to share? I'm kinda giving the Varus one a free pass since it's the only one thats coming to mind, but there could be other that I'm missing.

To be clear, I'm not the OP and I agree that Varus' story is way more interesting. I never cared much about Varus' lore, but I can understand why some people would be bothered by the family aspect being taken away.

Galio's lore changed quite a bit (which I was fine with because his old lore was so boring) which bothered some people. Karma's new story also caused a stir, but more because of what was added than what was taken/changed. Those are most controversial lore updates (on the boards at least) that I can think of.

Galio's accompanied him with a full VGU, so I don't really count that one. Otherwise, we could include Evelyn, WW, Poppy, etc to this list, but all those lore changes were necessary to fit their new kits and vision. Karma's a decent example too, although I haven't followed that one quite as closely and so I don't really have an opinion that I feel is meaningful enough to add regarding her changes. However, should be noted that Rengar's and Ahri's lore had been changed a while back and I didn't see any disdain over those ones, showing that Riot can alter lores and keep the player base around them happy.

I do think that most of the frustration around the new lore of Varus was that he was two gay lovers melded into one body with a Darkin. As with the frustration entailing Karma's added lore, maybe the gripe of the community is when introducing multiple minds into one being?

*I apologize, I had though you were OP and spoke on that assumption earlier, my bad D:*

> Galio's accompanied him with a full VGU, so I don't really count that one.

While you may not count it, others do/did because his core identity changed unlike WW (cursed being, prisoner to bloodlust) or Eve (too sexy, gonna kill you). I love the new Galio and think it was wise to change his core because there was not much to be interested in, but others liked the somber sentential and don't get the same buzz with the boisterous, happy-go-luck one.

> maybe the gripe of the community is when introducing multiple minds into one being

I haven't followed the debate much either, but it seems like people were upset with the fact that Karma is now a pacifist. My guess is Rito did that to differentiate her from Irelia who also hates killing, but still does so to protect her people.

> I apologize

No worries; no offence taken. Sorry if it seems like I'm trying to undermine you. I not fan of playing the devil's advocate. I think you and I both agree that the lore team is doing great for the most part. I'm just letting you know what I've seen people complain about.

No need to apologize back, I take all comments with a grain of salt and try to understand them. Besides, my Canadian blood forces me to apologize. Just be glad there's no 4 way stops on the boards, we'd be here for hours.
They changed him to a Darkin.
They did. I was referring the human(s) as I assumed everyone would catch on to that without me needing to type out an explanation of how Varus is now technically the horrific being.
What is the argument here? To still be pissy over an already addressed misshap. Or just festering on an obnoxious attitude.

DyQuill's advice to us was to keep talking about the lore so Riot's lore team doesn't forget all the awful mistakes they've made over the years. That was an enlightening moment to me since, after Riot apologized for Trundle and Fiora, I thought I wouldn't need to constantly remind Riot and the playerbase of those mistakes. Thanks to DyQuill I realize I was wrong at that time and my negligence helped lead to the mistake of the Varus rewrite.
This isnt a awful mistake though ...

False. It makes Varus less cohesive as a champion in a way that can't be solved without completely changing his gameplay kit. That damages the gameplay experience of League of Legends which Riot's manifesto states is the most important part of the game. Varus's rewrite is an objective failure according to how Riot evaluates their own work.
Varus' lore rewrite wasn't a failure. He needs a VGU but that doesn't mean his lore rewrite was a failure.

> [{quoted}](name=Splision,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=yGuE7i8u,comment-id=0000000300010000000000000000,timestamp=2018-04-24T03:42:22.733+0000)
>
> He needs a VGU

Wrong. Varus has an iconic gameplay kit that is fun and accessible to players of all skill levels, healthy for the game in terms of play/counterplay, and carves out its own niche in terms of strengths and weaknesses among the cast of adcs. A dramatic change to his kit to risk destroying this delicate balance in order to better match a lore update would be a grand sin. The most correct route for making Varus into a cohesive whole would be a lore revert.

That's an opinion. Not a fact. So far I've enjoyed most of the new lore that the narrative team is pumping out, and I've also enjoyed most if not all of the VGUs as well. Aatrox, a champion added to the roster after Varus, is getting a VGU. I don't see why Varus shouldn't.

> [{quoted}](name=Splision,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=yGuE7i8u,comment-id=000000030001000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-04-24T18:16:45.403+0000)
>
> That's an opinion. Not a fact.

Wrong. Varus's relevance and the quality of his gameplay is a documented fact supported by the posts and behavior of many Rioters over the years. For example, Varus is one of the adcs who received little to no work in the Marksman update because the team working on the update recognized his kit as already being healthy and iconic.

The fact that you've enjoyed the stories as standalone stories really doesn't have anything to do with what I'm talking about. The story meshes poorly with the gameplay, the story is disloyal to people who were already fans of the character, the actual quality of it is irrelevant. The Varus rework was a failure.

Aatrox is getting a VGU because his gameplay is garbage and has been since he went live. It didn't feel unique or fun, it didn't mesh with his lore, and it wasn't healthy for the game. Aatrox has needed a massive update since he was released.
I think the point was that saying “a lore revert is the most correct route” is an opinion, not a fact.

But that is also a fact which clearly follows from the other facts I have stated. There is a disconnect between his new lore and his gameplay which Riot has acknowledged. Riot puts gameplay first and Varus's gameplay is of high quality. Therefore, his gameplay should not be drastically changed. Therefore, the only remaining thing that can be changed is his lore.
Or they could simply update his visuals and VO.

It does. The Darkin, Varus, was known for being a bowmaster that used blighted arrows against his enemies. His weapon of choice and fighting style never changed in the new lore so his current gameplay fits with his new lore.

A lore change to match his gameplay, maybe. You said “a revert”, which would imply that only changing it back to what it was and not changing anything about his old lore is the most correct option. You are saying that the old lore of Varus was better than anything Riot could have written for him.

Saying that reverting his lore completely and not editing it to make more sense with his gameplay is the correct option is fine... but it’s your opinion. It’s not a hard fact. Saying it is implies that all other opinions are wrong, including those who actually like the rewrite. That’s a bit closed-minded.
I'm a devoted player, too. Your opinion is no better than mine.
Why are you such a downer.
Because they wholesale deleted a character and made League of Legends as a game worse for no defensible reason.

So we know this happens a year after Noxus leave Ionia.

But when is this story in timeline ? Present ? Past ? How many years ago if it's in the past ?

The war began like 9-10 years ago, when Darkwill was in his last years of power. How long was the war ?

Swain assumed power 7 years ago, and withdrew the armies of Noxus from Ionia.

He lost his arm at the Placidium 3 years before that, and the war had been going on for a while even by then. So it's fair to assume that Noxus invaded Ionia "more than ten years ago". :-)
I hope we get even a rough story line for  my sake, it's getting confusing personally to know when all these stuff take place and where we are now

> [{quoted}](name=AnyanKat,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=yGuE7i8u,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2018-04-23T16:20:35.686+0000)

Depends on who you want to stage as the present.

There are a lot of people who have their own "present" going on.

In fact, Akali's personal story is her in the "future" after growing up and doing her thing.  Which mean Shen and Zed would be old.

So we'll have Jhin, Shen, and Zed duking it out with Akali as a teen.  We'll have a full adult Akali in the future, and I'm sure the Kinkou in some form or another will appear during the war.

Hell, if we use Taliyah, this could be happening during her adventure in Shurima or WHILE she's getting there.

Remember that it seemed like Yasuo made up his mind when she realized she had to go save her people.

At the end of Taliyah's story, Yasuo is attacked for killing Elder Shouma, and in this story he has his hair tied back (and we know that Taliyah gave him the leather thing he uses to keep it tied back). So this has to take place AFTER that.

> [{quoted}](name=HalfTangible,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=yGuE7i8u,comment-id=000200000000,timestamp=2018-04-24T03:22:31.890+0000)

Oh, did I not say it like that? Lol. Thought I did, but yeah. I already expected Taliyah to have left before Yasuo went to the village.

Finally some answers about the Elder! it feels like a decade ago when the question "who killed the elder" poped on boards! i like this side of the lore, revolving around redemption and peace rather than a cosmic tier battle.

i have a question though, Ionian language? what are the roots of it? how did Riot develop it? 

Funny thing: there is already a player named Erzai on league.

Well it definitely draws inspiration from Asian languages, though Im not sure which. Ionia seems far closer to Japan than China in design to me.

If you ask me, the "language" is probably just a couple of words that can easily be translated into English. If you want to see a video game with an actual whole constructed language, take a peep at Star Citizen. They have an entire series of lore pages dedicated to learning the language, if you so feel like it. 

https://robertsspaceindustries.com/comm-link/spectrum-dispatch/16214-A-Quick-Guide-To-SRX

https://robertsspaceindustries.com/comm-link/spectrum-dispatch/16202-Xian-Dictionary (this page is absolutely massive. It might crash your browser)

Oh i'm actually familiar with SC , i spent few hundred dollars on that game ( although at this point i feel like i wasted my money since its taking forever)

Thats one of the reasons i wondered about the language. i was hoping for more than just few words to bring the story across. im fluent in Japanese myself and none of the words used in that story sounds Japanese to me. sounds more Elvish which is influenced by Finnish , Greek and Latin. i mean look at these words, Emai. Svasa. Anar , Dyeda , Erzai.

I believe they explained this a little when asked about Yasuo's famous "Hazaki" line.Ionian shares it's roots with Japanese, but it would be broken Japanese, so that when voice actors are speaking it in different languages, it doesn't so much feel as a translation, more of a completely foreign language. Also, this makes it so that when it is said in Japanese, everyone in Japan isn't just hearing the word "Wind" over and over, so it feels foreign to them as well. No idea on the lore implications, but that's the explanation behind it from a gameplay perspective.
There's no single Ionian language, it's very regional.

Damn, here I thought I still had the lore fresh in my mind.

With it being regional though, how does communication between different, err, regions, work? I would assume there a large amount of confusion, or at least being a translator is a very lucrative job in such a culture.

Well, Ionia is a continent - think of it a bit like Europe or maybe Pre-Colombian South America_ in terms of language diversity_.  I imagine that most of the time, no-one would need a translator for their day to day life - but people moving around a lot, or people who need to deal with far-reaching issues, would need to either share a common language, or find a translator to help.

Europe I see, that makes a lot more sense. For some reason, I always thought of Ionia as a very small continent, like Britain in comparison to Russia, where Demacia or Noxus would be Russia, for example.

All right, last question, I promise. How large is Ionia? Comparison to other countries in Runterra or countries in real life, either should help my mind conceive.
